translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions in Triads

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽21.50. Āsavavippayuttasāsavaduka, Sanidassanattika🔽Āsavavippayuttaṁ nasāsavaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavavippayutto sāsavo sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.🔽Āsavavippayuttaṁ naanāsavaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavavippayutto🔽sāsavo sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Gaṇitakena tīṇi.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  āsava vippayutta sa āsava duka  āsava vippayuttam na sa āsavam na sanidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca āsava vippayuttaḥ sa āsavaḥ sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka  āsava vippayuttam na anāsavam na sanidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca āsava vippayuttaḥ  sa āsavaḥ sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka gaṇitakena tīṇi
translated: The Section on the Triad without Resultants Associated with Cords of Offence

original: Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽(Āsavavippayuttanasāsavanaanidassanasappaṭighamūlepi purimanayeneva tīṇi pañhā.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… aññamaññe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi 🔽āsava vippayuttana sa āsavana anidassana sappaṭigha mūle pi purima nayena iva tīṇi pañhāḥ hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe aññamaññe ekam pe avigate tīṇi

original: Āsavavippayuttaṁ naanāsavaṁ naanidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavavippayutto🔽sāsavo anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ,
analyzed: āsava vippayuttam na anāsavam na anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca āsava vippayuttaḥ  sa āsavaḥ anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā eka
translated: With a non-contaminating, not a root, not a Dissociate element as condition, a non-contaminating, not a root, not a Dissociate element arises. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, one …
With predominance as condition, one … With non-adversion as condition, one …
